website_summaries.verdict: A great game for young kids that helps them learn while they have fun. As educational as this game is, it might not be worth the high price.
pros: Young kids learn shapes, colors, letters, and numbers while laughing along with the game
Teachers love using it in the classroom to improve cognitive skills
cons: Because it's no longer made, it's pricey no matter where you buy it

customer_reviews.title: great game, great seller
customer_reviews.text: great game, perfect for kids cognitive development. IT has shapes, colors, numbers. They can learn on all levels and its fun for adults to play along. This game is no longer in production and I was able to get it from this seller mjbooksales at a 1/4 of the cost compared to others. The seller said it was used but in good shape and that all pieces were counted. When I got it, it was as described. My kids and I couldn't be happier. Having a child with developmental delay, this is one game that gets her motivated to learn.
customer_reviews.author: energylightlove

customer_reviews.title: Daughter is very entertained.
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter turned two in December 2012. Before we got the game she was pretty good with numbers, colors, and shapes. Now, since playing the game daily (as she insists) she has improved. Since she is so young it does require adult supervision. It has also improved her hand eye coordination. Compared to her other games: Sneaky Snacky Squirrel, Hungry Hungry Hippos, and Whack-a-mole arcade, she prefers Cariboo.
customer_reviews.author: greenturtlehope

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo Game
customer_reviews.text: Did not have all the parts. Key and card tray was missing. Some of the doors don’t open properly.
customer_reviews.author: D Hedgehog

customer_reviews.title: So glad we replaced this!
customer_reviews.text: We had this a few years ago for our now seven year old daughter and when we lost it, we were kinda sad, but she had out grown it a bit by then. Well enter new baby now almost two. We play a lot of games with our older kids (10 and seven) and so we wanted a game that the little one can play too. So glad we were able to replace this. She loves it and it is fun for the whole family to play something with the little one. So far we are only using the color cards, but she is getting the hang of it. Thanks Cariboo! I only wish this game wasn't cancelled!
customer_reviews.author: Parents to HZ

customer_reviews.title: It's a Treasure
customer_reviews.text: I bought and played this game with my 2.5 year old niece. She loves it and asks to play daily. It is great for teaching her colors, 1, 2, 3, A, B, C, and shapes. She does not understand the concept of numbers yet so she struggles with those. However, she is getting much better daily with matching the others letters, colors, and shapes. I look forward to trying the advanced card set (included) when she gets good enough.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gaither

customer_reviews.title: Best. Game. EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest game ever. Every speech-language pathologist needs one in their collection. The game is no longer made, so it can be difficult to find. I play it at home with my children and also at work during speech therapy sessions.
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: My 2 and a half year old loves this game. It is quick to play and easy to understand. It can be played almost immediately out of the box. It helps if your child knows colors and basic shapes and the letters ABC and numbers 1-4 somewhat, but can reinforce that as well. My son has learned to bend down to spot the balls, but since you still have to get a matching card to open that door, it's not really much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chitown mom

customer_reviews.title: Need to Sell the New Version
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to receive the old version of this game. My daughter is three, and mastered the whole thing in two days. I don't think that Amazon should be selling the version without the whole alphabet and numbers one through ten. Also, Cranium is no longer giving away the expansion pack so unless you want to purchase the updated straight from cranium (cheaper btw) it cannot be fixed yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Battle

customer_reviews.title: Key broke
customer_reviews.text: The key broke and the game is pretty much useless now. Also some of the cards have been lost - it is now just a box that just sits and does not get played. Before the key broke, the grandkids loved this game. I would suggest the game but would also suggest maybe a better key.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Leslie Beery

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: it was supposed to be used for teaching 3 yr old son's game playing and alphabetics and numbers, but he was very interested in playing the balls and the treasure box alone. Anyway, well designed game!
customer_reviews.author: Fei Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Great price and condition for a hard to find game
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F

customer_reviews.title: Very good condition as promised
customer_reviews.text: Game was complete with just a little damage to box corner as the dealer said. Would order again from this dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Twila Arola

customer_reviews.title: Great for educators!
customer_reviews.text: As an SLP, I now see why it is a great therapy tool. And, the seller described it well. The used version is fabulous and very cost effective when compared to the cost of brand new!!
customer_reviews.author: Paula K.

customer_reviews.title: Great experience
customer_reviews.text: Product was great condition! Transaction was quick and easy! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M.

customer_reviews.title: Missing key
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, but this kit was missing its key ;(
customer_reviews.author: Holly Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great game for learning about taking turns, colors, and numbers
customer_reviews.text: My 2 1/2 year old autistic son loves this game. We started with the concept of taking turns and are building up to matching colors. This toy was suggusted to us by his ABA therapist and it has definately been a hit.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: My son just loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this game for any child three years of age or older. My son, who just turned five, got it this last Christmas and can't get enough of it. He can play it with his friends with minimal adult supervision. He loves it when he finds all the balls and can open the treasure. It's a bit educational because you have to know your color, shapes, and be able to count up to four.
customer_reviews.author: sob

customer_reviews.title: We love this game!
customer_reviews.text: My girls (ages 4and 2) ask to play this game over and over again. They love to see if the balls are under the compartments and they love when they open up the jewel at the end of the game. It is definitely a must have game!
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GAME FOR PRESCHOOL AGE CHILDREN
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son LOVES this game. The bright colors and activity involved keep his attention for at least 30 minutes. It's fun, educational, and interactive.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game because it was requested by my childs speech teacher. The game is a must have for little ones. I have changed the pictures to make the game more difficult. getting the chest to open at the end is the greatest thing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo is a hit with my grandchildren
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Cariboo for two sets of grandchildren. Both found the game highly entertaining and stimulating. The mother's loved it too. My order through Amazon arrived in Houston in good time even amidst hurricane Ike.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Vanorden

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for Young Kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my nephews, ages 4 and 2. It was a huge hit. Even after 5 months they still love playing it. Educationally, it requires basic matching skills (numbers, colors, shapes, letters). This is another great product from the folks at Cranium.
customer_reviews.author: Smeds

customer_reviews.title: Game for pre-schooler
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. We paid about $50 for a used game, and the game was in good playable shape, but the game itself is a little too simple for our four-year-old granddaughter. Also, the game construction is not great, because once a couple of the ball-cover-lids are opened, it is too easy to see if other balls are in adjacent spots. The best part about it for us is it is an activity one of us can do with a grandchild, but the actual game play is a little boring, and I think over-priced for what you get, especially if one purchased a new game, at about $150 retail, but that's just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: rus99

customer_reviews.title: Treasure Game
customer_reviews.text: I am a pediatric Speech-Language Pathologist for a Children's hospital in Virginia. My kids LOVE this game. It's durable and fun for all. It helps them to match and name colors, shapes, numbers and simple letters. It also allows me to help them with turn-taking and other pragmatic language skills. I highly recommend this for any early language population and preschoolers, but my own teenager loved to try it out as well!!
customer_reviews.author: groovychick

customer_reviews.title: Good quality BUT missing pieces! :(
customer_reviews.text: Good quality...however it said it had ALL the pieces but it was missing the gem in the treasure chest!! That was disappointing! Otherwise... good condition!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: ... game is missing parts and is not in the excellent condition that it was described to be in
customer_reviews.text: This game is missing parts and is not in the excellent condition that it was described to be in.
customer_reviews.author: Bigduke

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: Item was shipped quickly, but the plastic top/frame separated from the outer cardboard casing immediately upon opening. Nothing superglue can't fix, but annoying nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! I'm a speech language pathologist and there are so many ways to incorporate this game into therapy sessions to address their speech and language goals.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Reese

customer_reviews.title: Amazon toy purchase
customer_reviews.text: My parents had this game at their summer home. My 3 yr old grandson loved it. It kept his attention and had great educational value. I was unable to find new version of game. The seller offered a used version and the condition was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo
customer_reviews.text: Another terrific game for children with autism. It was fun for the rest of the kids too. My grandson is 6 yrs. old & had a great time playing the game from the start. It reinforces what his classroom aides are teaching.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo
customer_reviews.text: It's a great game that's kept my 2 & 3 year olds entertained for almost a year now. They don't actually play by the rules unless I'm there but they love hiding the balls and finding them with the key.
customer_reviews.author: bc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great game! so motivating and kids go crazy for it.
customer_reviews.author: eenifi

customer_reviews.title: Great for speech.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the game. We use it for his speech therapy at home improvement.
customer_reviews.author: chelsea Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year old and 2 1/2 year old love this game. There are two levels of play which is great for two different aged children. They love using the key to open the doors in the hopes of finding a ball on the other side. And they are learning colors, shapes, and letters at the same time. Great game.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dyk

customer_reviews.title: Learning Fun in a Preschool game.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun preschool + game of matching, numbers, turn taking, letter recognition. We play it as a family with a 20 month old and a 4 year old. THe thrill is when the treasure chest opens.
customer_reviews.author: Martha L

customer_reviews.title: The cranium Cariboo received is not new, one ball ...
customer_reviews.text: The cranium Cariboo received is not new, one ball, one key, and a few cards missing. Also the treasure (diamond) is broken. Awful!
customer_reviews.author: YAN SHEN

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy--fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. My daughter has figured out all the letters and pictures, colors, and shapes. She loves it. It's great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo Fun
customer_reviews.text: My sons absolutely LOVE this game. They don't make it any longer, so it is very hard to find. It is fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L

customer_reviews.title: Game
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Was packed well for shipping. Game is as described. The little treasure box had some sticky substance on it, was fine after washed. Inside the game with the doors opened, there was some dried up milky gunk that didn't smell very good. Washed it out. Overall the game is fine, would have liked it to be clean though.
customer_reviews.author: Jean F.

customer_reviews.title: Cariboo
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this game. She is young and it is a game that she can play with her dad.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3 year olds
customer_reviews.text: We loved it for our little kids. THey like it each time and it is a nice game that they totally get.
customer_reviews.author: Carolynn McCoppin

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: It's a very pleasant change from the usual games for the young ones and very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 tear old B'day Present
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a game that would appeal to my grandson.If I can get him inside he is use to v-smile & computer games. Cariboo held his interest enough to at least start to learn the concept of board games and taking turns.
customer_reviews.author: Zana S. Price

customer_reviews.title: Just what he wanted
customer_reviews.text: I got this as Christmas gift for my 4 yr old because he loved it at his Grandma's house. I can't wait to see his face when he opens it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L. Gemme

product_meta.title: Hasbro Gaming Cranium Cariboo
product_meta.description:
This game is an enjoyable way for your little one to learn the ABC's, numbers, shapes and colors. Each turn gives kids a chance to match fun drawings, unlock secret doors and discover hidden treasure. Designed especially for young children. For 2 to 4 players, ages 3 to 6 yrs. Imported.

AMAZON.COM
Taking a step away from trivia questions and clay sculpting, the makers of Cranium have instead created a game for teaching wee ones a few colors, shapes, numbers, and letters. (And, if you know 3- to 6-year-olds that won't lose all the included cards and balls, they may also learn sharing, cooperation, and imaginative play.) The bottom of the box houses the game itself, with three chutes along the top that the balls are dropped into and three rows of flip-up panels that are decorated with various colored objects. Players draw cards, match them to a panel, flip up the panel, and hope there is a ball underneath it. Once all six balls are recovered a treasure chest pops open and gameplay can begin anew. --Pam Lauer

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Cranium Cariboo is the magical treasure hunt game designed especially for young children. Kids love exploring the golden island of Cariboo, where they find castles, boats, balloons, and more. Cariboo reinforces four early-learning fundamentals, letters, numbers, shapes, and colors and it's packed with fun! Cariboo Expanded Edition grows with your child with an advanced set of cards that doubles the fun. Cranium Cariboo has received several prestigious awards, including the Platinum Best Toy Award from the Oppenheim Toy Portfolio.

See more
feature_bullets: Kids will love every minute of Cranium Cariboo as each turn gives them the chance to match fun drawings
Rounds of Cariboo last about 10 to 15 minutes, great for young attention spans
Kids learn while matching letters, numbers, shapes and colors AND practice sharing and turn-taking by passing the key with each turn
Cranium Cariboo comes with a Cariboo Island game board, six treasure balls, two sets of cards (beginner & advanced), one key, and a treasure chest
Cranium Cariboo is the magical treasure hunt game designed especially for young children
Unlock secret doors, and even discover hidden treasures

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars222 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
